title: robofleet-dashboard
description: The robofleet-dashboard repository hosts a web-based dashboard built with JavaScript, Python, HTML, and CSS to visualize and interact with data from a Robofleet system. This project provides a user-friendly interface for monitoring robot status, sensor readings, and mission progress, offering insights into robotic fleet operations and facilitating remote control and management. It's a valuable tool for anyone working with the Robofleet framework and looking for a clear and interactive way to analyze their robot's performance.

title: crud-expense-tracker
description: crud-expense-tracker is a simple, front-end project built with JavaScript, CSS, and HTML, utilizing Material-UI for a clean and responsive user interface. This application demonstrates fundamental CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) operations through a practical expense tracking system, providing a hands-on example of building interactive web applications.

title: devboard
description: Devboard is a full-stack web application built with Next.js 14 (Pages Router) and TypeScript, designed to serve as a project management dashboard. It leverages Material UI (MUI) for a responsive and intuitive user interface, React Query for efficient data fetching and caching, and modern CSS styling. This project demonstrates best practices for building robust web applications with Next.js, focusing on type safety, component reusability, and optimal performance.

title: jovian
description: Jovian is a Python-based CRUD application built with Flask, PostgreSQL, HTML, CSS, and shell scripting, designed as a project to demonstrate full-stack development principles. This repository showcases a functional implementation of create, read, update, and delete operations with a relational database, offering a practical example for learning web development with Python. The project emphasizes clean code structure and integration of various technologies to create a complete, deployable web application.

title: Map-Visualisation
description: Map-Visualisation is a project that leverages HTML and Python to create interactive map visualizations. This repository focuses on building tools and techniques for displaying geographical data on a map, enabling users to explore and understand spatial patterns and relationships within the visualized datasets. It serves as a practical demonstration of combining web technologies with data processing capabilities for insightful data exploration.

title: raven-v2
description: Raven-v2 is a project built with TypeScript and JavaScript, focusing on [insert the main purpose of the project from the README, e.g., "creating a modern note-taking application," or "experimenting with new web development techniques," or "building a personal website/portfolio"]. This repository showcases [mention key features or functionalities, e.g., "a clean and intuitive user interface," or "the implementation of a specific algorithm," or "a responsive design for various devices"] and serves as [mention the project's intended use, e.g., "a practical demonstration of modern web development practices," or "a personal portfolio project," or "a collaborative effort for learning and experimentation"].

title: NextJs-Dashboard
description: NextJs-Dashboard is a modern, responsive web application built with Next.js, TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, serving as a foundational project for creating interactive dashboards. It provides a structured architecture and pre-built components to streamline development, allowing developers to quickly build and customize their own data visualization and management interfaces.

title: next-idea-board
description: Next-Idea-Board is a project built with TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, designed to be a simple yet effective idea management tool. This repository provides a platform for brainstorming, organizing, and developing innovative concepts, allowing users to visually structure and prioritize ideas within a project management framework.

title: sleep-debt-tracker
description: Sleep Debt Tracker is a project built using TypeScript, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS designed to help users monitor and manage their sleep debt.  This application tracks sleep patterns, calculates sleep debt based on individual sleep goals, and provides insights to improve sleep habits, utilizing TypeScript for robust type safety and modern web development practices. This project serves as a practical example of using TypeScript in a front-end web application.

title: resume
description: This repository contains the source code for my resume, implemented using TeX for the document's structure and content, and HTML for potential online presentation or conversion. It serves as a practical project showcasing my skills and experience in a professional and easily customizable format, demonstrating proficiency in both typesetting and web technologies.

title: next-voting
description: Next-voting is a web application built with Next.js, TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, providing a platform for creating and participating in various voting polls. Focused as a project to explore modern web development practices, it leverages Next.js features for server-side rendering, routing, and API management to deliver a smooth and responsive user experience for vote creation, casting, and result visualization.

title: iot-asset-tracking
description: This repository hosts a full-stack asset tracking application built with Next.js, TypeScript, and Tailwind CSS, leveraging Supabase for backend functionality and real-time data management. Focused on IoT asset tracking, the project demonstrates a modern web development approach using serverless functions and a reactive UI, providing a comprehensive solution for managing and monitoring physical assets.

title: dynamic-event-calendar
description: dynamic-event-calendar is a JavaScript-driven project to create a visually appealing and interactive event calendar. Built with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, this project focuses on providing a dynamic user experience for scheduling and managing events, offering a flexible and customizable solution for displaying event information within a web application.

title: genietalks
description: GenieTalks is a full-stack web application built with TypeScript, Vite, Express.js, and leveraging the Gemini API, designed to provide engaging and interactive AI-powered conversations. This project utilizes a modern JavaScript stack including HTML, CSS, and client-side JavaScript to deliver a seamless user experience for exploring and interacting with AI-driven dialogue.

title: finance-with-python
description: This repository, built with Jupyter Notebooks and Python, contains a collection of finance-related projects. It explores various financial concepts and provides practical implementations using Python libraries, making it a valuable resource for learning and applying quantitative finance techniques. The projects demonstrate how to analyze financial data, build models, and automate financial tasks.

title: atg-world
description: ATG-World is a web-based project built with TypeScript, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS. Focusing on [insert purpose from README, e.g., showcasing global data visualization or creating an interactive world map], this repository explores [mention key functionality from README, e.g., geographical data manipulation and user interface design]. It serves as a learning ground for modern web development techniques and provides a foundation for [mention potential future applications, e.g., interactive data exploration or location-based services].

title: ros-log-viewer
description: ros-log-viewer is a web-based tool designed for visualizing and analyzing ROS (Robot Operating System) log files. Built with a combination of JavaScript, Python, HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting, this project provides a user-friendly interface to parse, filter, and explore ROS log data, facilitating easier debugging and performance analysis for ROS-based applications. This project is centered around providing developers with a valuable debugging tool.

title: fruit-seller
description: Fruit-Seller is a comprehensive e-commerce project built with Next.js 14 (Pages Router), TypeScript, and Material UI (MUI), leveraging React Query for efficient data fetching and state management. This project showcases best practices in building type-safe and performant web applications, exploring key e-commerce functionalities while demonstrating the integration of modern front-end technologies.
